paragraphs.title: Categories of Data We Collect
paragraphs.textCondensed:
To conduct our activities we will be collecting sensitive personal data (Art 9 GDPR). When we do need to process sensitive personal data, it is with the consent of the individual unless it is obtained indirectly for legitimate purposes:

  • Personal identification documents that may reveal race or ethnic origin, or physical health, and possibly biometric data of private individuals.

paragraphs.title: Lawful reasons for processing Data
paragraphs.textCondensed:
The following reasons are used when we collect and use personal data to operate our business and provide our products and services (Art 6 GDPR):

  • Consent – We may rely on your freely given consent at the time you provided your personal data to us.
  • Medical diagnosis – We may process personal data to provide a medical diagnosis. 
  • Legitimate interests – We may rely on legitimate interests based on our evaluation that the processing is fair, reasonable and balanced. These include:
    • Delivering services and products – To deliver the services and products our clients have engaged us to provide.
    • Scientific Research purposes – To help technological development (Recital 159 GDPR).
  • Legal obligations and public interest – We may process personal data in order to meet regulatory and public interest obligations.

paragraphs.title: Storage and Protection of Your Data
paragraphs.textCondensed:
Whenever we collect or process personal data, we will keep it for as long as is relevant for the purpose for which it was collected. 

We use pseudonymization to protect your personal and sensitive data against loss or other forms of unlawful processing (Art 32 GDPR). This technique enables us to comply with the GDPR principle of data minimisation (Art 5 GDPR).

We endeavour, through pseudonymization, to replace any identifying characteristics of data with a pseudonym, or, in other words, a value which does not allow the data subject to be directly identified.

paragraphs.title: Selling your Data
paragraphs.textCondensed: We do not sell any of the data we have collected

paragraphs.title: Your rights over your Personal Data
paragraphs.textCondensed:
You have the right to request:

  • Access to the personal data we hold about you, free of charge.
  • Withdrawal of your consent for use of your personal data.
  • That we stop any consent-based processing of your personal data after you withdraw that consent.
  • The deletion of your personal data, in accordance with the right to be forgotten (Art 17(2) GDPR).
